column4: ï»¿is there a reason that openoffice.org and openoffice.org-base aren't installed on ubuntu? should they be? when i try sudo apt-get upgrade in the terminal it says a bunch of openoffice.org packages are being held back,  anyone know what could be wrong?
i'm thinking that could be it...
did anyone have problems updating tonight?
should i install openoffice.org and openoffice.org-base in ubuntu? are they supposed to be installed by default?

lifeisfunny: soundray: joot: the reason i ask is because my update wont complete because a bunch of openoffice.org packages are being held back. the crazy thing is i dont think those packages were installed by default. all my openoffice.org apps still work.
all I know is that my oo is updating ok
are you sure you have those 2 packages installed?
I yes for one I will check for base one moment
Both are in my default hardy heron..
just making sure, were they the "core" packages or were they straight up openoffice.org and openoffice.org-base ?
they are the straight up oo.org and oo.org base.. did I make a bad???
no :) thanks, i guess i just need to install those packages and try updating again
OK sorry I cannot help more. You do have the repositories yes?
i have all the ubuntu repos enabled
